meanings.definition: To turn into or treat as a commodity.
meanings.sent1: The company commoditized their products to increase sales.
meanings.sent2: In today's market, many goods are commoditized for easy purchase.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I'd see the day when even friendship could be commoditized.
meanings.sent4: Her unique talent was commoditized like a mass-produced item.
meanings.sent5: The idea of love being commoditized felt cold and impersonal.

meanings.definition: To make something widely available and interchangeable.
meanings.sent1: The internet has commoditized information for everyone to access.
meanings.sent2: Globalization has commoditized certain goods across borders.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my mom had commoditized her famous cookies by sharing the recipe.
meanings.sent4: His creativity was commoditized, losing its individuality in the process.
meanings.sent5: The app commoditized the service, making it affordable for all.
